doc.ContractDescription: MODIFICATION ISSUED TO PROVIDE NAVSUP WSS N241 ASSIGNED SERIAL NUMBERS.
PURCHASE OF MECHANICAL COMPONENTS, CONTROLS, AMPLIFIERS, CABLES, SERVICES AND WARRANTIES.
IGF::OT::IGF BLANKET PURCHASE AGREEMENT CALL FOR ENTRY CONTROL FACILITIES EVALUATION, NWS SEAL BEACH, CALIFORNIA

THE PROPOSED RESEARCH FOCUSES ON DEVELOPING KEY DATA MANAGEMENT AND MACHINE LEARNING TECHNIQUES FOR ADAPTIVE ENERGY MANAGEMENT, OCCUPANT SATISFACTION AND BUILDING AUTOMATION IN A GREEN OFFICE BUILDING THE SUSTAINABILITY BASE, AND IN A LARGER SMART COMMUNITY CONSISTING OF CERTAIN NASA AMES LEGACY BUILDINGS, SUCH AS BLDG. 23, FEDERATED WITH THE SUSTAINABILITY BASE. THESE BUILDINGS, IF NOT ALREADY INSTRUMENTED, WILL BE EQUIPPED WITH A VARIETY OF SENSORS, COLLECTING EXTENSIVE DATA FROM THIS DISTRIBUTED WEB OF THINGS . THE GOAL IS FOR THIS LARGE SCALE SENSOR‐ENABLED SYSTEM TO INTERACT WITH BUILDING MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS, WITH USERS VIA THEIR SMART PHONE SENSORS, AND WITH THE CLOUD, TO OFFER OPTIMIZED OVERALL ENERGY CONSUMPTION WHILE MAINTAINING OR INCREASING OCCUPANCY SATISFACTION LEVELS THROUGH LOCALIZED ADAPTIVE BEHAVIORS. THESE INSTRUMENTED BUILDINGS WILL PRODUCE A STREAM OF REAL TIME DATA TO BE ANALYZED AND USED FOR A VARIETY OF PURPOSES, INCLUDING THE DESIRED ADAPTIVE CONTROL AND FUTURE STATE ESTIMATION CAPABILITIES. ONE EXAMPLE OF STATE ESTIMATION IS OCCUPANCY SENSING AND MODELING. HEATING, VENTILATION AND AIR CONDITIONING HVAC IN SELECTED ZONES OF A BUILDING CAN BE TURNED ON OR OFF IN ANTICIPATION OF OCCUPANCY‐ PEOPLE ARRIVING OR LEAVING AT VARIABLE TIMES. UNLIKE LIGHTING, WHICH CAN TURN ON OR OFF IMMEDIATELY BY DETECTING PRESENCE OR ABSENCE OF PEOPLE, HVAC IS ASSOCIATED WITH TIME DELAYS, BASED ON ROOM SIZE, TYPE OF HVAC SYSTEM AND NUMBER OF PEOPLE IN THE ROOM. FURTHERMORE, OPTIMAL HVAC ACTIONS DEPEND ON ENVIRONMENTAL DATA SUCH CURRENT OR PREDICTED WEATHER, INTERNAL HUMIDITY, TRAFFIC CONDITIONS AFFECTING PEOPLE ARRIVING OR LEAVING, KNOWN SPECIAL EVENTS OR CONFERENCES, MEETINGS, ETC. HVAC IS JUST ONE EXAMPLE OPPORTUNITY. MORE GENERALLY, THE BUILDING MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS NEED TO MAKE SENSE OF THE DATA STREAM TO ENABLE STATE ESTIMATION, SITUATION AWARENESS, AND PREDICTIONS FOR A RANGE OF APPLICATIONS. IN THE PROPOSED RESEARCH, WE WILL DEVELOP SCALABLE, ROBUST SOFTWARE SYSTEMS TO FUSE THE SENSOR DATA WITH THE ADDITIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL INFORMATION, AND DISTRIBUTE ACTIONABLE INFORMATION TO PEOPLE AND SYSTEMS IN A CONTEXT AWARE WAY.

doc.ContractDescription: WORK SHALL FOCUS ON IMPLEMENTATION OF METHODS FOR WEATHER-AWARE FLIGHT PATH PLANNING. THE MAIN FOCUS WILL BE ON AVOIDANCE OF SEVERE WEATHER, BUT IT SHALL INCLUDE A CAPABILITY FOR MINIMIZING FUEL REQUIREMENTS DURING FLIGHT. THIS INCLUDES: 1. IMPLEMENTATION OF FLIGHT PLANNING ALGORITHMS ON A LOW-POWER COMPUTER (SUCH AS A TABLET). 2. DEVELOPMENT OF A DATA FORMAT FOR WEATHER INFORMATION (OR SELECTION AND ADAPTATION OF AN EXISTING FORMAT SUCH AS GPIB2). 3. DEMONSTRATION OF WEATHER-AWARE FLIGHT PLANNING ON A TABLET COMPUTER.

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF THE HEATSHIELD FOR EXTREME ENTRY ENVIRONMENT (HEEET) PROJECT, FUNDED BY NASA'S SPACE TECHNOLOGY MISSION DIRECTORATE UNDER THE GAME CHANGING DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM (GCDP), IS AN ELEMENT WITHIN THE ADVANCED ENTRY DESCENT AND LANDING MATERIALS (AEDLM) PROJECT WITHIN GCDP. UNDER THIS STATEMENT OF WORK (SOW), THE HEEET PROJECT SEEKS TO MATURE A GAME CHANGING WOVEN THERMAL PROTECTION SYSTEM (TPS) TECHNOLOGY TO ENABLE IN-SITU ROBOTIC SCIENCE MISSIONS RECOMMENDED BY THE NASA RESEARCH COUNCIL (NRC) PLANETARY SCIENCE DECADAL SURVEY (PSDS) COMMITTEE. RECOMMENDED SCIENCE MISSIONS INCLUDE VENUS PROBES AND LANDERS, SATURN AND URANUS PROBES, AND HIGH SPEED SAMPLE RETURN MISSIONS. DUE TO THEIR EXTREME ENTRY ENVIRONMENTS, MOST OF THESE MISSIONS ARE LIMITED TO HERITAGE-LIKE MATERIALS SUCH AS CARBON PHENOLIC (CP) AS THEIR ONLY TPS SOLUTION. HERITAGE CP, DUE TO ITS INHERENT PROPERTIES, CONSTRAINS THE MISSION TRADE SPACE AND IN THE LONG TERM POSES SIGNIFICANT SUSTAINABILITY CHALLENGES. SINCE THERE IS NO OFF-THE-SHELF HERITAGE CP AVAILABLE CURRENTLY CERTIFIED FOR NASA MISSIONS, EXTENSIVE DEVELOPMENT EFFORTS WILL HAVE TO BE CARRIED AS PART OF MISSION PROPOSALS LEADING TO HIGHER RISK OF NOT BEING SELECTED UNDER THE COMPETED PROCESS. THE GOAL OF HEEET IS TO DEVELOP A WOVEN TPS TECHNOLOGY TO TRL 5/6 THAT WILL PROVIDE AN ALTERNATE TPS SOLUTION FOR THESE MISSIONS, BUYING DOWN SOME OF THE DEVELOPMENT RISKS FOR FUTURE MISSIONS. FURTHERMORE, WOVEN TPS IS A SCIENCE ENABLER THAT WILL ALLOW FOR VERY HIGH RETURN ON THE INVESTMENT MADE BY BOTH NASA SPACE TECHNOLOGY MISSION DIRECTORATE (STMD) FOR ENABLING TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT AS WELL AS SCIENCE MISSION DIRECTORATE (SMD) ON THE SCIENCE SIDE UNDER NEW FRONTIER (NF) OR DISCOVERY PROGRAMS. IN COLLABORATION WITH SMD LEADERSHIP THAT SUPPORTS THIS EFFORT AND WITH NF / DISCOVERY PROPOSING ORGANIZATIONS AND THEIR PRINCIPLE INVESTIGATORS, HEEET WILL DEVELOP WOVEN TPS HEATSHIELD ARCHITECTURES TO TRL 5/6 BY 2016/2017.

doc.ContractDescription: EXAMINING AIRCRAFT, SATELLITE, AND MODELING DATA FROM HS3 TO ADVANCE UNDERSTANDING OF HURRICANES ACCURATE FORECASTS OF TROPICAL CYCLONES ARE NEEDED TO MITIGATE THE POTENTIALLY LARGE ECONOMIC AND HUMAN IMPACT UPON LANDFALL. YET, FORECASTING TROPICAL CYCLONE SIZE AND INTENSITY REMAINS A DIFFICULT TASK LARGELY BECAUSE OF OUR LACK OF OBSERVATIONS AND UNDERSTANDING OF A STORMS INTERNAL DYNAMICS. THIS PROPOSAL WILL FOCUS ON UTILIZING AIRBORNE RADAR DATA, SATELLITE OBSERVATIONS, AND MODEL SIMULATIONS IN AN EFFORT TO ADVANCE THE KNOWLEDGE AND PREDICTION OF TROPICAL CYCLONES (NASAS WEATHER FOCUS AREA). DURING THE NASA HS3 FIELD CAMPAIGN (2012-2014), THE NASA HIWRAP RADAR WAS DEPLOYED INTO HURRICANE GONZALO (2014) TO DOCUMENT THE REFLECTIVITY AND KINEMATIC STRUCTURES OF ITS INTERNAL FEATURES. HIWRAP IS A RECENTLY DEVELOPED RADAR WITH A UNIQUE SCANNING GEOMETRY, WHICH REQUIRES NEW DATA PROCESSING ALGORITHMS. THE PROPOSED WORK WILL DEVELOP AND EXAMINE PROCESSING ALGORITHMS AND APPLY THEM TO THE HS3 HIWRAP DATA. HIWRAP AND OTHER AIRBORNE INSTRUMENTS WILL PROVIDE HIGH-RESOLUTION OBSERVATIONS OF THE INTERNAL FEATURES, WHILE SATELLITE OBSERVATIONS WILL PROVIDE NECESSARY TEMPORAL AND SPATIAL CONTEXT TO SUPPLEMENT THE ANALYSIS. THESE DATA WILL BE COMBINED TO ASSESS THE CHARACTERISTICS OF THE OBSERVED FEATURES AND TO INTERPRET GONZALOS DYNAMICAL EVOLUTION. WE WILL ALSO DEVELOP A KNOWLEDGE BASE FOR SATELLITE REPRESENTATIONS OF AIRCRAFT-OBSERVED INTERNAL PROCESSES THAT CAN BE USED TO ASSESS AND PREDICT TROPICAL CYCLONE EVOLUTION WORLDWIDE. LASTLY, MODEL SIMULATIONS WITH DATA ASSIMILATION WILL BE EXAMINED TO LINK THE PROCESSES INVOLVED IN GONZALOS EVOLUTION. WE WILL USE MODEL SENSITIVITY TESTING AND FULLY ASSIMILATED MODEL ANALYSES TO DETERMINE THE CRITICAL FACTORS GOVERNING TROPICAL CYCLONE INTENSITY AND SIZE. THESE SAME RESEARCH STEPS WILL BE USED TO ANALYZE FUTURE HIWRAP OBSERVATIONS OF TROPICAL CYCLONES, WHICH WILL BE COLLECTED DURING NOAAS SENSING HAZARDS WITH OPERATIONAL UNMANNED TECHNOLOGY (SHOUT) FIELD PROGRAM. WITH THESE RESULTS, WE WILL HELP TO IMPROVE HURRICANE FORECASTING, WHICH IS A KEY GOAL OF NASAS EARTH SCIENCE RESEARCH PROGRAM.
